decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast Primeval Titan and trigger its powerful land fetching ability. It utilizes cards like Amulet of Vigor, Azusa, Lost but Seeking, and Dryad of the Ilysian Grove to generate additional land drops and quickly reach the necessary mana for Primeval Titan. Once Primeval Titan hits the battlefield, it can search for lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Field of the Dead to create powerful board presence and win conditions. The deck aims to assemble its combo pieces quickly and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful land interactions.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing fast and efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, while also utilizing burn spells like Lava Spike, Rift Bolt, and Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent. The deck aims to apply early pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot, preventing them from stabilizing and mounting a comeback. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all necessary colors for casting spells efficiently.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures while disrupting the opponent with Chalice of the Void and removal spells. The key strategy is to ramp up mana with Urza lands and Expedition Map, enabling early plays of Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher. Karn, the Great Creator provides additional disruption and utility, while Ugin, the Ineffable can generate value and control the board. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive elements, ultimately outpacing and defeating the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful cards like Urza, Lord High Artificer and Jace, the Mind Sculptor. It includes disruptive spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also features versatile counter spells like Cryptic Command and Archmage's Charm to protect its own threats. The win condition of the deck revolves around the Thopter Foundry and Sword of the Meek combo, creating an army of flying Thopters to close out the game. The mana base includes a mix of fetch lands and snow-covered lands to ensure consistency and flexibility.

The focus of this deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost aggressive creatures and burn spells, while also utilizing card draw to maintain momentum. By efficiently utilizing mana and casting spells that deal direct damage to the opponent, this deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero by putting constant pressure and forcing them to respond quickly. The inclusion of cards like Bedlam Reveler and Light Up the Stage allows the player to refill their hand and keep up the pressure throughout the game.

The deck focuses on using Eldrazi creatures with disruptive abilities to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It includes powerful planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and provide additional threats. The deck also features cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base centered around Urza's lands and Eldrazi Temple, the deck aims to quickly put out large threats and overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on controlling the board through counterspells and removal spells, while also generating card advantage with cards like Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck looks to stabilize the board with creatures like Spell Queller and Stoneforge Mystic, before closing out the game with powerful threats such as Jace, the Mind Sculptor and the equipment Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine. The land base is designed to provide a consistent mana base while also offering utility with cards like Celestial Colonnade and Field of Ruin.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and burn spells. The synergy between creatures like Kiln Fiend and Monastery Swiftspear, along with spells like Crash Through and Lava Spike, allow for rapid pressure on the opponent's life total. The deck also includes card draw and burn spells like Lightning Bolt to maintain momentum and finish off the opponent. Overall, the aim is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and direct damage spells to win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful control elements and card advantage to outlast and outmaneuver opponents. By utilizing cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler, alongside countermagic and removal spells, the deck aims to control the game while deploying threats like Snapcaster Mage and Stoneforge Mystic to pressure opponents. The inclusion of powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine provides additional win conditions and value. The mana base is tuned to provide consistency and flexibility, allowing the deck to adapt to various matchups effectively.

This deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent through efficient and powerful creatures, backed up by disruption and removal spells to control the board. Tarmogoyf, Bloodbraid Elf, and Scavenging Ooze provide a strong and versatile creature base, while Liliana of the Veil and Thoughtseize disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a mix of removal spells like Lightning Bolt, Fatal Push, and Assassin's Trophy, the deck aims to maintain board control while steadily chipping away at the opponent's life total. The land base is optimized for consistency and mana fixing, allowing for smooth gameplay and strong starts.

The deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. It includes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to disrupt the opponent's hand and deal massive damage. The deck also utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void and Karn, the Great Creator to control the game and shut down opponent's strategies. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, the deck aims to outpace the opponent and secure a victory in the early game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a mix of powerful planeswalkers, counter spells, and removal cards. It also includes creatures that can draw cards and generate value over time. The deck aims to stabilize the board, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and eventually win through card advantage and efficient threats. The mana base is designed to support all the necessary colors and ensure smooth gameplay. The inclusion of cards like Field of the Dead and Crucible of Worlds provides additional value and resilience against opposing strategies.

This deck focuses on leveraging powerful control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while gradually gaining card advantage and board presence through efficient threats and card draw. The combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Spell Queller allows the deck to interact effectively with a wide range of strategies. Meanwhile, powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Teferi, Time Raveler provide additional card advantage and utility. By controlling the game's tempo and resource advantage, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents to secure victory.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively and using Death's Shadow as a powerful threat that scales with your life total. The deck includes a mix of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Stubborn Denial to control the game, along with removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember to deal with opposing threats. Additionally, cards like Mishra's Bauble and Traverse the Ulvenwald help to dig for key pieces while also fueling Death's Shadow. Overall, the deck aims to quickly reduce your own life total to maximize the power of Death's Shadow and overwhelm your opponent.

This Jund aggro deck focuses on early disruption with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, followed by powerful threats like Tarmogoyf and Kroxa, Titan of Death's Hunger. The deck also features efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Fatal Push to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. Additionally, the deck utilizes planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Wrenn and Six to generate card advantage and provide additional value. The mana base is optimized for consistency and the deck aims to close out games quickly with a mix of aggressive creatures and versatile spells.

The main concept of this UWx control/midrange deck is to utilize a variety of powerful cards to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to efficiently remove threats with cards like Path to Exile and Spell Queller, while also providing card advantage and tempo with Snapcaster Mage and Teferi, Time Raveler. The inclusion of Stoneforge Mystic allows for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine to provide additional threats and value. This deck is designed to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.
